title: Find maximum element in binary tree without recursion.

title: How to implement Level Order Traversal in Binary Tree?
content:
Trees can also be traversed in level-order, where we visit every node on a level before going to a lower level. This search is referred to as a breadth-first search (BFS), as the search tree is broadened as much as possible on each depth before going to the next depth.

title: How to implement PostOrder Traversal in Binary Tree?
content:
PostOrder Traversal is different from InOrder Traversal and PreOrder Traversal. In this Traversal approach we first traverse through left and then right and at the end, we traverse to the node data.
In PostOrder traversal, the root is visited after both subtrees. PostOrder traversal is de

title: How to implement InOrder Traversal in Binary Tree?
content:
The Technique for traversal in an Inorder is slightly different from what we were doing in PreOrder Traversal. Here we go through left node, then data and then the right node.
In an InOrder traversal, the root is visited between the subtrees. InOrder traversal is defined as follows:

title: How to implement PreOrder Traversal in Binary Tree?
content:
In pre-order traversal, each node is processed before (pre) either of it's sub-trees. This is the simplest traversal to understand. However, even though each node is processed before the subtrees, it still requires that some information must be maintained while moving down the tree.

title: What is a Tree Data Structure?
content: A tree is a data structure similar to a linked list but instead of each node pointing simply to the next node in a linear fashion, each node points to a number of nodes. A tree is an example of non-linear data structures. A Tree structure is a way of representing the hierarchical nature of a stru

title: What is a Queue?
content:
A queue is a data structure used for storing data (similar to Linked Lists and Stacks). In a queue, the order in which data arrives is important. In general, a queue is a line of people or things waiting to be served in sequential order starting at the beginning of the line or sequence.

title: What is a Stack?
content: A stack is a simple data structure used for storing data (similar to Linked Lists). In stack the order in which the data arrives is important.
